frontmatter.title: Large-Scale Whole-Genome Sequencing of Three Diverse Asian Populations in Singapore
categories: Atomistic Simulations and Design in Biology
frontmatter.description: Underrepresentation of Asian genomes has hindered population and medical genetics research on Asians, leading to population disparities in precision medicine. By whole-genome sequencing of 4,810 Singapore Chinese, Malays, and Indians, we found 98.3 million SNPs and small insertions or deletions, over half of which are novel.
